results.headline: Powell Flags Risks, Samsung Faces ‘Indefinite’ Labor Strike | Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 7/10/24
results.summary: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

results.headline: NATO Arms Pledge, Samsung Strike, More
Samsung’s Labor Union Prepared to Strike ‘Indefinitely’
results.summary: Samsung Electronics Co.’s labor union said it’s prepared to extend its ongoing strike for an indefinite period. On Monday, workers walked off the job to stage what originally was a three-day rally to demand better pay. Annabelle Droulers reports on Bloomberg Television.

results.authors: By Shinhye Kang and Sohee Kim
results.headline: Samsung Union Calls ‘Indefinite’ Strike to Throttle Chipmaking
results.summary: Samsung Electronics Co.’s labor union of 28,000-plus workers declared an indefinite strike in a move that threatens production at the world’s largest maker of memory chips.

results.headline: NATO Promises More Arms For Ukraine, Samsung Strike Indefinite
Samsung Strike Is a Taste of AI's Future
results.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping the global labor market, and the South Korean tech titan is on the front line.

results.headline: US Opens $1.6 Billion Competition for Chip Packaging Research
results.summary: The Biden administration is launching a $1.6 billion funding competition for chip packaging research and development projects, marking the latest attempt to revitalize the domestic semiconductor industry.

results.authors: By Ken Parks and Daniel Cancel
results.headline: Uruguay, Home to Marcos Galperin, David Velez, Seeks More Tech Talent
results.summary: Home of CEOs of MercadoLibre, Nu, Globant looks to develop tech talent

results.headline: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day: Americas
results.summary: Good morning. Investors stay upbeat while waiting for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s testimony, Citigroup says take profit on AI and President Joe Biden’s battles continue. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino

results.headline: KKR Plans to Cut Its Stake in Kokusai Electric, Reuters Says
results.summary: KKR & Co. plans to sell about half of its stake in newly listed Kokusai Electric Corp. to secure returns from a rally that’s more than tripled the Japanese chip gear maker’s stock price.
